net.mdwright.var

Interface VarCalculator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HistoricalSimVar, ModelBuildingVar

    public interface VarCalculator
    Interface for different approaches to VaR calculations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio, int timeHorizon, double probability)
      Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the historical sim model.
      java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio, int timeHorizon, double probability, VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
      Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the model-building model.
      Portfolio getData() 

    • Method Detail

      • calculateVar

        java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio,
                                  int timeHorizon,
                                  double probability,
                                  VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
        Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the model-building model.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - An array of Positions containing ticker symbols and values for each position in the portfolio
        timeHorizon - An int value representing the of days to calculate VaR over
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        volatilityChoice - Enum representing the desired variance method to be used
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the portfolio

      • calculateVar

        java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio,
                                  int timeHorizon,
                                  double probability)
        Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the historical sim model.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - An array of Positions containing ticker symbols and values for each position in the portfolio
        timeHorizon - An int value representing the number of days to calculate VaR over
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the portfolio

        Portfolio getData()
